page.title: 09Recreational Facilities
page.content: Little and Great Raveley have little in the way of organised recreation in their villages apart from those which are home based, although there are allotments available. Wistow, a larger village, has more facilities. A small playgroup and a recently completed BMX track cater for the village children. Many indoor activities are based at the Public House where Darts and Pool are played in the local league and where dominoes are also available. More varied sport facilities are provided at St. Ives and Huntingdon. With the nearest cinema and theatre 7 and l3 miles away television and the recent introduction of home videos provide an important area of recreation. A limited amount of game shooting takes place and the Fitzwilliam and Cambridgeshire Harriers occasionally hunt the area.
